boat.name: Sirius
boat.full_description:
'Sirius' was the 17th boat built by the Dadsons for a Mr Jeffries on Rutland Water in south east England. He owned her for many years until being sold to Mike Baumber in about 2000. She is built from mahogany on steamed oak ribs, with ply deck and cabin.

'Sirius' changed hands in 2006 and had new sails made by John Raven of Maldon. She was repainted green. Her mast tabernacle was moved forwards by about 12" to improve the way she sails single handed on mainsail alone.

When the plywood deck and cabin top rotted, it was not replaced so she is now a fine dayboat.
boat.short_description: 'Sirius' 16' gunter rigged, clinker cabin cruiser, built Faversham by Dick Dadson in 1968.
